channel.title: Virtualcenter on IvoBeerens.NL | All about End User Computing, AVD, W365 and Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
channel.description: Recent content in Virtualcenter on IvoBeerens.NL | All about End User Computing, AVD, W365 and Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

item.title: Missing datastore (LUN), EnableResignature
item.description: After investing the log files on the VMware ESX host i found the following message: Jan 22 12:39:34 boz101 vmkernel: 152:21:01:58.702 cpu4:1040)ALERT: LVM: 4476: vml.020003000060a980004335434b464a4b77554e59744c554e202020:1 may be snapshot: disabling access. See resignaturing section in SAN config guide. It seems that the VMFS volume has been detected with a different LUN ID.

item.title: The VMware VirtualCenter Server service terminated unexpectedly
item.description: After rebooting the VMware VirtualCenter (VC) server, i was unable to logon using the VI-client in VC. In the Windows event log the following Error is listed: Event Type: Error Event Source: Service Control Manager Event Category: None Event ID: 7031 Date: 25-9-2008 Time: 13:39:58 User: N/A Computer: VC1 Description: The VMware VirtualCenter Server service terminated unexpectedly.

item.title: Choosing between SQL 2005 Express or SQL standard/Enterprise for the VC database
item.description: VMware VirtualCenter uses standard the Micrososft SQL Express 2005 database. The statement of VMware is: Microsoft SQL Server 2005 Express is intended to be used for small deployments of up to 5 hosts and 50 virtual machines Microsoft SQL 2005 Expresss supports 1 CPU, 1 GB of RAM and a maximum database size of 4 GB.
